data.text: Hear ye this, O house of Jacob,
For they call themselves of the holy city,
I have declared the former things from the beginning;
Because I knew that thou art obstinate,
I have even from the beginning declared it to thee;
Thou hast heard, see all this;
They are created now, and not from the beginning;
Yea, thou heardest not; yea, thou knewest not;
For my nameâ€™s sake will I defer mine anger,
Behold, I have refined thee, but not with silver;
For mine own sake, even for mine own sake, will I do it:
Hearken unto me, O Jacob, and Israel my called;
Mine hand also hath laid the foundation of the earth,
All ye, assemble yourselves, and hear;
I, even I, have spoken; yea, I have called him:
Come ye near unto me, hear ye this;
Thus saith the Lord, thy redeemer, the Holy One of Israel;
O that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments!
Thy seed also had been as the sand,
Go ye forth of Babylon, flee ye from the Chaldeans,
And they thirsted not when he led them through the deserts:
There is no peace, saith the Lord, unto the wicked.
